With years of expertise in HT/LT cable installations, solar plant commissioning, and comprehensive electrical contracting, we ensure safety, efficiency, and sustainability in every project.

cta.note: We're here to help you make the best decision for your energy needs.

q1.question: Who is Krishiva Innovatives and what do you offer?
q1.answer:
Krishiva Innovatives is a solar EPC company focused on rooftop solar.
We design, install, and maintain solar systems for homes and businesses.
Our team manages survey, engineering, installation, and commissioning.
We also guide you on paperwork, subsidies, and long-term service support.

q2.question: What is a rooftop solar power system?
q2.answer:
A rooftop solar system is a set of solar panels fixed on your roof.
The panels convert sunlight into usable electricity for your property.
It includes an inverter, mounting structures, wiring, and safety devices.
The system can be grid-connected, hybrid, or off-grid depending on need.

q3.question: How does a rooftop solar system work every day?
q3.answer:
Solar panels absorb sunlight and generate DC electricity.
An inverter converts this DC power into AC power for your appliances.
Your home first uses solar power, and then draws from the grid if needed.
Any extra power can be exported to the grid under net metering policies.

q4.question: How can I apply for solar subsidies through Krishiva Innovatives?
q4.answer:
Subsidies are provided under government-approved solar programs.
We share the latest central and state subsidy rules for your location.
Our team supports your registration, document upload, and portal steps.
We coordinate with DISCOM or nodal agencies until your case is processed.

q5.question: What is the cost of a rooftop solar system without subsidy?
q5.answer:
Cost mainly depends on the system size measured in kilowatts (kW).
Roof type, structure height, cable length, and brand choice also affect price.
On-grid systems are usually more economical than hybrid or battery systems.
We provide a transparent, item-wise quotation after a site visit and load check.

q6.question: Why is choosing solar power a smart decision?
q6.answer:
Solar power cuts your electricity bills for many years.
It protects you from future tariff hikes and daytime power cuts.
Solar energy is clean and supports a greener, low-carbon lifestyle.
It also improves your property’s value and modern, eco-friendly image.

q7.question: Is rooftop solar safe for my home and family?
q7.answer:
Yes, rooftop solar is very safe when designed and installed correctly.
We use approved components, proper earthing, and surge protection devices.
All wiring follows standard safety practices to avoid shocks and short circuits.
Periodic inspections keep the system healthy and safe over the long term.

q8.question: What should I check before installing rooftop solar?
q8.answer:
Your roof should have enough shadow-free space for solar panels.
We evaluate roof strength, access, and orientation towards the sun.
Your current load, sanctioned load, and existing wiring are reviewed.
Permissions, meter location, and inverter placement are planned in advance.

q9.question: Why should I choose an on-grid solar system?
q9.answer:
On-grid systems let you use solar power and grid power together.
Extra solar units are sent to the grid and adjusted through net metering.
They are more cost-effective than battery-based systems for most homes.
Maintenance is simpler, and components are widely available and serviceable.

q10.question: What is net metering in simple words?
q10.answer:
Net metering tracks both imported and exported electricity at your meter.
When solar generation is higher than use, extra power goes to the grid.
When your usage is higher, you draw power back from the grid as usual.
Your bill is based on the net difference over the billing period.

q1.question: How long does a rooftop solar plant usually last?
q1.answer:
Most quality solar panels come with 20–25 year performance warranties.
Inverters generally need replacement once in 10–12 years, depending on usage.
Structures and cables last long with basic checks and timely tightening.
With proper design and care, a plant can work reliably for decades.

q2.question: Is maintaining a rooftop solar plant costly?
q2.answer:
Routine maintenance costs are quite low for rooftop solar systems.
Main activities are cleaning panels and checking connections and earthing.
Annual health checks or service contracts are affordable if you prefer.
Overall, savings on electricity bills far exceed the maintenance expense.

q3.question: Can solar panel installation damage my roof?
q3.answer:
We use engineered mounting structures suited to your roof type.
Fixing is done with proper fasteners, sealants, or ballast as required.
Correct installation prevents leakage and uneven load on the roof.
A professional EPC like Krishiva Innovatives safeguards your roof integrity.

q4.question: Do solar panels need regular cleaning?
q4.answer:
Yes, panels should be cleaned to remove dust, bird droppings, and mud.
Clean panels allow more sunlight and maintain higher power generation.
Frequency depends on local dust levels and weather conditions.
We guide you on safe cleaning methods or offer scheduled cleaning support.

q5.question: Can non-concrete roofs support solar panels?
q5.answer:
Many non-concrete roofs can take solar with the right structure design.
We assess sheet thickness, purlin spacing, and overall strength on site.
Special mounting structures and clamps are used for metal or tin roofs.
If a roof is unsuitable, we suggest alternate mounting options if possible.

q1.question: What is the approximate cost of a rooftop solar plant?
q1.answer:
Approximate cost is usually given per kilowatt of capacity installed.
Residential on-grid systems are typically more economical per kW.
Site complexity and premium component choices can increase pricing.
We share a clear proposal with final cost after understanding your needs.

q2.question: What is the typical payback period for rooftop solar?
q2.answer:
Payback depends on your tariff, usage pattern, and system size.
Most well-designed rooftop systems pay back in around 4–6 years.
Higher electricity rates or good subsidies can shorten this period.
After payback, most of the energy you generate is net savings.

q3.question: Are government subsidies available for rooftop solar?
q3.answer:
Government subsidies are generally available for eligible consumers.
Policies differ by state, consumer category, and sanctioned load.
We inform you about current central and state-level subsidy schemes.
Our team helps you follow the correct process to claim eligible benefits.

q4.question: How can I apply for subsidy in Madhya Pradesh?
q4.answer:
Subsidy in Madhya Pradesh is routed through approved program portals.
You need to choose an empanelled vendor and register your project online.
We help with portal registration, document upload, and DISCOM coordination.
Final subsidy is released as per government norms after verification.

q5.question: Does Krishiva Innovatives help with EMI or finance options?
q5.answer:
Yes, we can connect you with finance or EMI partners where available.
Banks or NBFCs may offer loans tailored for rooftop solar projects.
We share basic project details and documents needed by lenders.
Loan approval and terms depend on the financier’s independent evaluation.
